heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 08 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.3°C), outside temperature (down 7.1°C), and inside temperature (down 3.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 576 m) and light levels (up 3996 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4557 lux) and cloud levels (up 551 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 575.8m lower than yesterday, 417.9m lower than the past week, 550.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 993m to a maximum of 2630m, averaging 1046.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1464.7m and 1597.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
